# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_lines = []

    for word in words
        line = ""
        while length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            pushed = push!(wrapped_lines, line)
            if !pushed && pushed != nothing
                break
            end
            line = ""
        end
        line *= word * " "
        if length(line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(wrapped_lines, line[1:end-length(word)])
            line = word * " "
        end
        line += "\n"
    end
    
    # Add the last line if it hasn't been added yet
    if length(line) > 0 && !any(x -> x == line, wrapped_lines)
        push!(wrapped_lines, line)
    end
    
    return join(wrapped_lines, "")
end
```

Example:
```julia
text = "This is an example of a very long text that exceeds the maximum text width"
result = wrap_string(text, 20)
println(result)
```
